segment.source: Working with Custom UE-V Templates and the UE-V Generator
segment.target: Working with Custom UE-V Templates and the UE-V Generator

segment.source: Working with Custom UE-V Templates and the UE-V Generator
segment.target: Working with Custom UE-V Templates and the UE-V Generator

segment.source: Working with Custom UE-V Templates and the UE-V Generator
segment.target: Working with Custom UE-V Templates and the UE-V Generator

segment.source: In order to roam applications between user computers, Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) uses settings location templates.
segment.target: In order to roam applications between user computers, Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) uses settings location templates.

segment.source: Some settings location templates are included with User Experience Virtualization.
segment.target: Some settings location templates are included with User Experience Virtualization.

segment.source: You can also create, edit, or validate custom settings location templates with the UE-V Generator.
segment.target: You can also create, edit, or validate custom settings location templates with the UE-V Generator.

segment.source: The UE-V Generator monitors an application to discover and capture the locations where the application stores its settings.
segment.target: The UE-V Generator monitors an application to discover and capture the locations where the application stores its settings.

segment.source: The application being monitored must be a traditional application.
segment.target: The application being monitored must be a traditional application.

segment.source: The UE-V Generator cannot create a settings location template for the following application types:
segment.target: The UE-V Generator cannot create a settings location template for the following application types:

segment.source: Virtualized applications
segment.target: Virtualized applications

segment.source: Application offered through terminal services
segment.target: Application offered through terminal services

segment.source: Java applications
segment.target: Java applications

segment.source: Windows 8 applications
segment.target: Windows 8 applications

segment.source: Validate UE-V Settings Location Templates with UE-V Generator
segment.target: Validate UE-V Settings Location Templates with UE-V Generator

segment.source: Standard and Nonstandard settings locations
segment.target: Standard and Nonstandard settings locations

segment.source: The UE-V Generator helps you identify where applications look for settings files and registry settings that applications use to store settings information.
segment.target: The UE-V Generator helps you identify where applications look for settings files and registry settings that applications use to store settings information.

segment.source: You can use the UE-V Generator to open the application as part of the discovery process to capture settings in standard locations.
segment.target: You can use the UE-V Generator to open the application as part of the discovery process to capture settings in standard locations.

segment.source: Standard locations include the following:
segment.target: Standard locations include the following:

segment.source: Registry Settings – Registry locations under HKEYCURRENTUSER
segment.target: Registry Settings – Registry locations under HKEYCURRENTUSER

segment.source: Application Settings Files – Files stored under UsersUser nameAppDataRoaming
segment.target: Application Settings Files – Files stored under UsersUser nameAppDataRoaming

segment.source: The UE-V Generator excludes locations which commonly store application software files do not roam well between user computers or environments.
segment.target: The UE-V Generator excludes locations which commonly store application software files do not roam well between user computers or environments.

segment.source: The UE-V Generator excludes these locations.
segment.target: The UE-V Generator excludes these locations.

segment.source: Excluded locations are as follows:
segment.target: Excluded locations are as follows:

segment.source: HKEYCURRENTUSER registry keys and files to which the logged-on user cannot write values
segment.target: HKEYCURRENTUSER registry keys and files to which the logged-on user cannot write values

segment.source: HKEYCURRENTUSER registry keys and files that are associated with the core functionality of the Windows operating system
segment.target: HKEYCURRENTUSER registry keys and files that are associated with the core functionality of the Windows operating system

segment.source: All registry keys that are located in the HKEYLOCALMACHINE hive (Requires Administrator rights and might require UAC agreement to set)
segment.target: All registry keys that are located in the HKEYLOCALMACHINE hive (Requires Administrator rights and might require UAC agreement to set)

segment.source: Files that are located in Program Files directories (Requires Administrator rights and might require UAC agreement to set)
segment.target: Files that are located in Program Files directories (Requires Administrator rights and might require UAC agreement to set)

segment.source: Files located in Users User name AppData LocalLow
segment.target: Files located in Users User name AppData LocalLow

segment.source: Windows operating system files that are located in %systemroot% (Requires Administrator rights and might require UAC agreement to set)
segment.target: Windows operating system files that are located in %systemroot% (Requires Administrator rights and might require UAC agreement to set)

segment.source: If registry keys and files stored in these locations are required in order to roam application settings, you can manually add the excluded locations to the settings location template during the template creation process.
segment.target: If registry keys and files stored in these locations are required in order to roam application settings, you can manually add the excluded locations to the settings location template during the template creation process.
